Dictionary of Tasks

Source: R/mlr_tasks.R

A simple Dictionary storing objects of class Task. Each task has an associated help page, see mlr_tasks_[id].

Usage

See Dictionary.

See also

Other Dictionary: Dictionary, mlr_learners, mlr_measures, mlr_resamplings, mlr_task_generators

Other Task: TaskClassif, TaskRegr, TaskSupervised, Task, mlr_task_generators

Examples

mlr_tasks$ids()
#> [1] "bh"      "iris"    "mtcars"  "pima"    "sonar"   "spam"    "titanic"
#> [8] "zoo"    
as.data.table(mlr_tasks)
#>         id    type     measures nrow ncol logical integer numeric character
#> 1:      bh    regr     regr.mse  506   19       0       3      13         0
#> 2:    iris classif classif.mmce  150    5       0       0       4         0
#> 3:  mtcars    regr     regr.mse   32   11       0       0      10         0
#> 4:    pima classif classif.mmce  768    9       0       0       8         0
#> 5:   sonar classif classif.mmce  208   61       0       0      60         0
#> 6:    spam classif classif.mmce 4601   58       0       0      57         0
#> 7: titanic classif classif.mmce  891   12       0       4       2         0
#> 8:     zoo classif classif.mmce  101   17      15       1       0         0
#>    factor ordered
#> 1:      2       0
#> 2:      0       0
#> 3:      0       0
#> 4:      0       0
#> 5:      0       0
#> 6:      0       0
#> 7:      5       0
#> 8:      0       0
mlr_tasks$get("iris")
#> <TaskClassif:iris> (150 x 5)
#> Target: Species
#> Features (4):
#> * dbl (4): Petal.Length, Petal.Width, Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width
#> 
#> Public: all_classes, backend, cbind(), class_n, class_names, clone(),
#>   col_info, col_roles, data(), feature_names, feature_types, filter(),
#>   formula, groups, hash, head(), id, levels(), measures, ncol,
#>   negative, nrow, positive, properties, rbind(), replace_features(),
#>   row_ids, row_roles, select(), set_col_role(), set_row_role(),
#>   target_names, task_type, truth(), weights
head(mlr_tasks$get("iris")$data())
#>    Species Petal.Length Petal.Width Sepal.Length Sepal.Width
#> 1:  setosa          1.4         0.2          5.1         3.5
#> 2:  setosa          1.4         0.2          4.9         3.0
#> 3:  setosa          1.3         0.2          4.7         3.2
#> 4:  setosa          1.5         0.2          4.6         3.1
#> 5:  setosa          1.4         0.2          5.0         3.6
#> 6:  setosa          1.7         0.4          5.4         3.9

# Add a new task, based on a subset of iris:
data = iris
data$Species = factor(ifelse(data$Species == "setosa", "1", "0"))
b = as_data_backend(data)
task = TaskClassif$new("iris.binary", b, target = "Species", positive = "1")

# add to dictionary
mlr_tasks$add("iris.binary", task)

# list available tasks
mlr_tasks$ids()
#> [1] "bh"          "iris"        "iris.binary" "mtcars"      "pima"       
#> [6] "sonar"       "spam"        "titanic"     "zoo"        

# retrieve from dictionary
mlr_tasks$get("iris.binary")
#> <TaskClassif:iris.binary> (150 x 5)
#> Target: Species
#> Features (4):
#> * dbl (4): Petal.Length, Petal.Width, Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width
#> 
#> Public: all_classes, backend, cbind(), class_n, class_names, clone(),
#>   col_info, col_roles, data(), feature_names, feature_types, filter(),
#>   formula, groups, hash, head(), id, levels(), measures, ncol,
#>   negative, nrow, positive, properties, rbind(), replace_features(),
#>   row_ids, row_roles, select(), set_col_role(), set_row_role(),
#>   target_names, task_type, truth(), weights

# remove task again
mlr_tasks$remove("iris.binary")
